body:
Comment 1: 
Your argument doesn't seem compelling.  The odd cases here are io.ReaderFrom and
io.WriterTo; everything else uses int.  And those cases use int64 because they are
designed to transfer a large amount of data in a series of calls; the other functions
are only called once.  It's easy to make your program work by adding a conversion to
int64.  (And your program should probably use io.WriteString rather than fmt.Fprint.)
_Status changed to **WorkingAsIntended**._
